master_databases.BFD: BIG-BFD Film and TV Show Views Based Metadata

changes_from_v21_00_to_v22_00: BUG FIX: views_*_global column naming clarified - 'global' was misleading
RENAME: views_*_global -> views_*_total (total views before country allocation)
FIX: Removed 'global' from countries_18 array (was 19 items, now truly 18)
CLARIFICATION: 'total' = allocation source (100%), 'row' = Rest of World (2%)
COLUMN NAMING: Added _temporal_column_naming_standards with clear rules
BACKWARD COMPAT: Added column_aliases for legacy views_*_global references
VALIDATION: Added rule_15 for total vs country sum conservation
changes_from_v20_00_to_v21_00: FLIXPATROL COLUMNS: Defined ONLY 3 FlixPatrol-specific columns (flixpatrol_id, flixpatrol_points, flixpatrol_rank)
FIELD MAPPING: All other FlixPatrol API fields map to existing BFD columns (MERGE, not CREATE)
INGESTION ACTIONS: Defined MERGE, APPEND, SKIP rules for each FlixPatrol field
DATA PRIORITY: Established source priority hierarchy (TMDB > IMDb > FlixPatrol for metadata)
SCHEMA ENFORCEMENT: Schema MUST be used for all FlixPatrol data ingestion
changes_from_v80_17: DATABASE VERSION V18.00: Major synchronized database build
MAPIE V18.00: Both BFD and Star Schema now at V18.00
STAR SCHEMA: 204,205,513 rows x 4 columns (576 MB)
changes_from_v80_12: DATE FIELD MAPPINGS: Added _date_field_mappings section for release date field translations (IMDb startYear, TMDB air_date, FlixPatrol Release, Hulu Original Premiere Date, Apple Release)
END DATE MAPPINGS: Added _end_date_field_mappings section for series conclusion (IMDb endYear, TMDB last_air_date/status/in_production)
MAX SEASONS AUDIT: Added _max_seasons_field_mappings - MISSION CRITICAL audit for season row production (TMDB number_of_seasons, IMDb derived, FlixPatrol seasons)
RELEASE VALIDATION: start_year is CANONICAL for release validation, premiere_date REMOVED (inherits from series)
STREAMING AVAILABILITY TERMS: Added Hulu 'Expiring', Apple 'Leaving Soon', Netflix 'Last Day to Watch', Prime 'Leaving Prime'
PLATFORM EXCLUSIVITY: Added amazon_prime_originals and netflix_originals rules to exclusivity patterns
INGESTION VALIDATION: Added rules for cross-source reconciliation and data quality checks
changes_from_v80_11: SOCIAL SIGNALS: Added multi-platform social signal integration (6 platforms)
NEW X-FEATURES: 8 new social X-features (abs_social_buzz_v2, abs_tiktok_engagement, etc.)
TALENT METRICS: Added cast/talent social footprint tracking
SENTIMENT ANALYSIS: Added sentiment scoring from social mentions
MAPE IMPROVEMENT: Target improved from ~9% to ~6.3% (30% better)
changes_from_v80_10: PLATFORM EXCLUSIVITY: Added studio-based exclusivity patterns (BritBox for BBC/ITV content)
INTERNATIONAL EXCLUSIVITY: Added reverse exclusivity for K-drama, Nordic, European, Turkish content
API VERIFICATION: Platform availability verified via Streaming Availability API (60+ countries)
NEW COMPONENT FILES: platform_exclusivity_patterns.json, international_content_exclusivity.json, streaming_api_platform_availability.json, platform_canonical_mapping.json
changes_from_v80_00: STAR SCHEMA: Split into Cranberry_Titles (fact) + Cranberry_Platform_Views (dimension)
AVAILABILITY-AWARE: Platform views only allocated where title IS ACTUALLY AVAILABLE
SPARSE STORAGE: Platform views stored as rows (not columns) - ~50M rows vs 4,320 columns
LOOKUP INTEGRATION: streaming_lookup_*.json files gate platform allocation
VERSION CONVENTION: All outputs renamed to Cranberry_[descriptor] pattern
changes_from_v70: Updated UK normalization with GB/GBR mapping
notes: GB is canonical ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 code for United Kingdom - UK alias deprecated
X-Features are OPTIONAL (nullable) - can be null if abstract data unavailable
WVV = Views x Completion x beta_p x lambda_g^-1
FLIXPATROL: Only 3 dedicated columns - all other data merges to BFD columns
V22.00: 'total' suffix = worldwide sum, 'row' suffix = Rest of World allocation (2%)
changes_from_v80_18: STUDIO VS PRODUCTION COMPANY: Clear distinction between physical studios and production companies
NEW COLUMNS: studio_facility, studio_facility_type, production_company_primary, production_company_type_corrected
DEFINITION FIX: 'studio' now correctly refers to physical facilities only
DEFINITION FIX: 'production_company' now correctly refers to content creators only
DATABASE CORRECTION: Automated classification of misplaced entities
changes_from_v80_19: DATABASE VERSION SYNC: Schema now aligned with BFD V19.82
BUG FIX P0: Zero-variance temporal columns rebuilt with GPU-vectorized engine (temporal_views_engine.py V2.0)
BUG FIX P3: Phantom seasons detection expanded from 2 to 403 rows (fix_phantom_seasons.py)
BUG FIX P4: IMDB mismatches corrected for The Traitors franchise (fix_imdb_mismatches.py)
STAR SCHEMA: Rebuilt from corrected BFD (update_star_schema_v19_80.py)
ML ENSEMBLE: 3-model GPU ensemble (XGBoost, CatBoost, cuML RF) with 1350 trees each
TRAINING DATA VALIDATED: IMDB Seasons Allocated.csv (224,394 rows) - 100% fc_uid overlap, 100% season_number match
COLUMN TRANSLATIONS: imdb_rating->imdb_score, imdb_votes->imdb_vote_count, cast->cast_data documented
changes_from_v80_20_to_v20_00: ISO 3166-1 COMPLIANCE: Standardized all country codes to ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 format
GB FIX: 'gb' country code deprecated in favor of 'GB' (ISO standard)
STREAMING LOOKUP: streaming_lookup_gb.json renamed to streaming_lookup_gb.json
COUNTRY FIELD: All country_code fields now use uppercase ISO codes
COMPONENTS UPDATED: platform_allocation_weights.json, streaming_lookup files standardized
ALGO VERSION: Updated to FC-ALGO-90.5 with full 13-directory engine integration
BACKWARD COMPATIBILITY: 'gb' accepted on ingestion, normalized to 'GB' internally
changes_from_v22_00_to_v23_00: TV SEASON END DATE RETRIEVAL: Added _season_end_date_retrieval_rules section
TMDB SEASON ENDPOINT: Documented /tv/{tv_id}/season/{season_number} for season-level air_date of last episode
TMDB APPEND_TO_RESPONSE: Added last_episode_to_air retrieval via /tv/{tv_id} endpoint
IMDB DATASETS: Added title.episode.tsv file mapping for episode-level air dates
OMDB API: Added Year field parsing for series date ranges (e.g., 2010-2015)
TVMAZE FALLBACK: Added TVMaze API as alternative source for accurate episode-level data
RETRIEVAL WORKFLOW: Documented 3-step workflow for season end date retrieval
ACCURACY NOTES: Added guidance for currently-airing seasons and missing data handling
SOURCE PRIORITY: Established TMDB > TVMaze > IMDb > OMDb for season end dates
changes_v23_20: COUNTRY EXPANSION: Added 4 new countries (hk=Hong Kong, ie=Ireland, ru=Russia, tr=Turkey)
COUNTRIES ARRAY: Updated from countries_18 to countries_22 (18 + 4 new = 22 allocations)
NEW COLUMNS: 80 new views columns for hk/ie/ru/tr (quarterly + half-yearly 2021-2026)
RATIO FEATURES: Added 10 country allocation ratio columns (ratio_{country}_to_global)
DEPRECATED COLUMNS REMOVED: 17 columns removed from BFD (interaction features, multipliers, computed_views)
DATABASE VERSION: BFD_V23.20.parquet (765,860 rows x 1,696 columns after cleanup)
changes_from_v23_00_to_v24_00: ALGO VERSION: Updated from ALGO-80/90.5 to ALGO-95.2 (production algorithm)
TOPOLOGY REFERENCE: Updated to ViewerDBX Platform Engine & Topology v10.00.pdf
MASTER DATABASES: Added explicit master_databases section (BFD, Star Schema, Abstract Data, Training Data)
BASED_ON: Updated all references from ALGO-80 to ALGO-95.2
COUNTRY FILES: Updated to 22 country streaming lookup files
CANON COLUMN STRUCTURE: Documented 1711 column taxonomy per topology v10.00

COLUMN GROUPS: Identity & IDs (1-6), Core Metadata (7-70), Views by Half-Year & Country (72-245), Views by Quarter & Country (246-651), ML Lag Features (652-859), ML Bucket Features (860-1032), Interaction Features (1033-1080), Computed Weights (1081-1082), Extended Views US/CN (1083-1122), Historical Views 2021-2022 (1123-1350), Future Views 2026 (1351-1426), Abstract Signals (1427-1452), Country-Specific Predictions (1455-1660), Platform & Aggregates (1661-1700), Studio Classification (1701-1711)
VALIDATION RULES: Updated rule_6 schema_version to 24.00
HARDWIRED PATHS: Updated all ALGO 80 references to ALGO 95.2
CONFORMITY CHECK: Validated against ViewerDBX Platform Engine & Topology v10.00.pdf
changes_from_v24_00_to_v25_00: NEW COLUMN: streaming_release_date - Exact date content becomes available on streaming platform
NEW COLUMN: is_catalog_addition - Boolean flag (True when premiere_date year < start_year)
DATA MODEL CLARIFICATION: premiere_date = original theatrical/broadcast date (immutable)
DATA MODEL CLARIFICATION: start_year = streaming availability year
DATA MODEL CLARIFICATION: streaming_release_date = exact streaming availability date
CATALOG ADDITIONS: 40,747 records flagged where old content added to streaming later
changes_from_v25_00_to_v26_00: NEW COLUMN: nielsen_minutes_millions - Nielsen-reported minutes viewed in millions
NEW COLUMN: avg_view_duration_min - Average viewing duration assumption per view (valuable for views calculation)
NEW COLUMN: streaming_platform_primary - Primary streaming platform for title (source platform)
NEW COLUMN: period_start - Start date of measurement period (YYYY-MM-DD format)
NEW COLUMN: period_end - End date of measurement period (YYYY-MM-DD format)
NEW COLUMNS: views_weekly_* - 20 weekly views columns for Nielsen weekly data (18 countries + total + row)
COLUMN GROUP: Added Nielsen Weekly Views (1712-1733) for weekly temporal granularity
DATA SOURCE: Added Nielsen Weekly Streaming Top 10 as primary weekly views source
FORMULA SUPPORT: conversion_formula column documents how views are calculated from minutes
DATABASE FILES: BFD_V26.00.parquet updated with new columns

_views_total_vs_country_architecture.description: CRITICAL: Clarification of 'total' vs 'country' view columns (V22.00 bug fix)
_views_total_vs_country_architecture.reason: V21.00 had misleading naming: 'global' in countries_18 array caused confusion
_views_total_vs_country_architecture.bug_fixed: countries_18 array had 19 items (included 'global'), now truly has 18 countries

step_1_ml_prediction.description: ML ensemble generates a single predicted view count per title per period
step_1_ml_prediction.note: This is the TOTAL worldwide views before any geographic allocation

step_2_country_allocation.description: Total views are split proportionally into 18 country allocations

row_suffix.meaning: Rest of World - countries not individually tracked
row_suffix.note: ROW is ONE of the 18 country allocations, NOT a synonym for 'total'

conservation_law.validation_query: SELECT fc_uid FROM bfd WHERE views_q1_2024_total != (views_q1_2024_us + views_q1_2024_cn + ... + views_q1_2024_row)

column_rename_v22.reason: 'global' was ambiguous - could mean 'worldwide total' or 'globally available platforms'
column_rename_v22.migration: Rename all *_global columns to *_total in Phase 6 output

_temporal_column_naming_standards.description: Canonical naming standards for temporal view columns (V22.00)

total_columns.description: Worldwide total views BEFORE country allocation

views_*_global.reason: 'global' was ambiguous and appeared in countries_18 array incorrectly

_column_aliases_backward_compat.description: Backward compatibility aliases for renamed columns (V22.00)
_column_aliases_backward_compat.implementation_note: Code should check for alias if canonical column not found

_flixpatrol_ingestion_rules.description: CANONICAL FlixPatrol data ingestion rules - Schema MUST be used for all FlixPatrol API data processing
_flixpatrol_ingestion_rules.criticality: HIGH - Ensures data consistency and prevents column proliferation

flixpatrol_specific_columns.description: ONLY these 3 columns are FlixPatrol-specific. NO OTHER FlixPatrol columns should be created.

flixpatrol_points.notes: Daily/weekly point accumulation from FlixPatrol rankings

flixpatrol_rank.description: Title's ranking position on FlixPatrol lists

field_mapping_to_bfd.description: FlixPatrol API fields that MERGE INTO existing BFD columns - DO NOT create new columns

ingestion_actions.MERGE: Update BFD column if BFD value is NULL/empty, otherwise keep existing
ingestion_actions.APPEND: Add to existing value (e.g., source_apis_used list)
ingestion_actions.SKIP: Do not ingest - data not needed or unreliable from this source
ingestion_actions.OVERWRITE: Always use FlixPatrol value (rare - only for FlixPatrol-specific data)

mappings.notes: IMDb ID - only use if BFD imdb_id is NULL
TMDB ID - only use if BFD tmdb_id is NULL
Title name - only use if BFD title is NULL
Release date - streaming availability date, may differ from original air date
Plot synopsis - only use if BFD overview is NULL
Production budget - only use if BFD budget is NULL
Box office revenue (movies) - maps to BFD revenue column
Total number of seasons (TV series) - CRITICAL for row production
Alternate field name for premiere date
Alternate field name for seasons count

fields_to_skip.description: FlixPatrol fields that should NOT be ingested

source_priority.description: When same field available from multiple sources, use this priority (1=highest)

x_feature_derivation.description: X-Features derived FROM FlixPatrol data (computed, not stored directly)

features.notes: Normalized FlixPatrol points as abstract signal

x_feature_derivation.note: These are COMPUTED features, not direct FlixPatrol columns

ingestion_workflow.step_1: Load FlixPatrol data from API or file
ingestion_workflow.step_2: For each record, lookup existing BFD row by imdb_id or tmdb_id
ingestion_workflow.step_3: If match found: Apply field mappings per action (MERGE/APPEND/SKIP)
ingestion_workflow.step_4: If no match: Create new row with FlixPatrol data as seed, mark for enrichment

validation_rules: RULE 1: NEVER create columns prefixed with 'fp_' or 'flixpatrol_' except the 3 defined
RULE 2: Always attempt to match existing BFD rows before creating new
RULE 3: FlixPatrol data is TERTIARY priority (after TMDB, IMDb)
RULE 4: flixpatrol_points and flixpatrol_rank should be updated daily
RULE 5: Log all merge/skip decisions for audit trail

collection_config.collection_schedule: Daily at 02:00 AM EST via SCHIG

_date_field_mappings.description: Canonical mapping of release date fields across data sources
_date_field_mappings.reason: Different APIs/databases use different field names for release dates. This mapping ensures consistent interpretation.
_date_field_mappings.canonical_purpose: The canonical release year for a TV season. Used as the primary indicator for released vs unreleased content.

imdb.notes: Stored at series level, derived from first episode release. For seasons, may reflect S1 premiere.

tmdb.notes: Available at season and episode level. More granular than IMDb.

flixpatrol.notes: When title became available on a streaming service. May differ from original air date.

hulu.notes: Internal field for when content premiered. May include windowed releases.
hulu.example: Original Premiere Date for licensed content

netflix.notes: Netflix uses Release Date for both originals and licensed content.

start_year.purpose: Canonical release year for release validation
start_year.validation: If start_year > current_year, content is unreleased

premiere_date.purpose: Original series premiere date (may be S1 for TV)
premiere_date.warning: NOT reliable for season-level release validation - often inherits from parent series

status.validation: If status in [Upcoming, Announced, In Production], content is unreleased

release_validation_rules.rule_1: Primary: Check status field - if 'Upcoming' or similar, block allocation
release_validation_rules.rule_2: Secondary: Check start_year > current_year - if true, block allocation
release_validation_rules.rule_3: DO NOT use premiere_date for release validation (inherits from series)
release_validation_rules.rule_4: For seasons, start_year indicates the SEASON release year, not series

_end_date_field_mappings.description: Canonical mapping of series END date fields across data sources
_end_date_field_mappings.reason: Different APIs use different fields for series conclusion. This ensures consistent interpretation of when a show ended.
_end_date_field_mappings.canonical_purpose: The year a TV series concluded. NULL/empty if series is ongoing.

imdb.notes: When series finished airing. NULL if ongoing.

tmdb.notes: last_air_date is the final episode air date. status can be 'Ended', 'Returning Series', 'Canceled'. in_production is boolean.

flixpatrol.notes: FlixPatrol focuses on streaming availability, not production metadata. Does not track series end dates directly.
flixpatrol.alternative: Use release/premiere dates for availability tracking

streaming_availability_terms.description: Streaming services use availability terms, NOT series end dates

hulu.meaning: Content leaving platform due to licensing expiration, NOT series cancellation

apple_tv.meaning: Content availability window ending, NOT series conclusion
apple_tv.notes: Internal field names not publicly available

end_year.validation: If end_year is not NULL and < current_year, series has concluded

status.notes: For last season detection: if status in ['Ended', 'Canceled'] AND season_number = max(season_number), it's the final season

last_season_detection.rule_1: If end_year is populated AND end_year <= current_year, series has ended
last_season_detection.rule_2: If status in ['Ended', 'Canceled'], series has ended
last_season_detection.rule_3: Last season = MAX(season_number) WHERE imdb_id = series_id
last_season_detection.rule_4: For ended series, views decay should be accelerated (no new content expected)
last_season_detection.implementation: JOIN on imdb_id to find max season_number, mark is_final_season=True

on_ingest: If end_year provided and > start_year: validate series timeline
If end_year < start_year: DATA ERROR - flag for review
If status='Ended' but end_year is NULL: attempt to infer from last_air_date
If in_production=false but status='Returning Series': DATA INCONSISTENCY
cross_source_reconciliation: Prefer IMDb endYear as canonical (most reliable)
Use TMDB status as secondary confirmation

_season_end_date_retrieval_rules.description: CANONICAL rules for retrieving TV season end dates from external APIs and datasets
_season_end_date_retrieval_rules.reason: Season end dates are not directly available from most APIs. This section documents the correct retrieval workflow to determine when each season concluded.
_season_end_date_retrieval_rules.canonical_purpose: The air date of the final episode of a specific TV season. NULL if season is currently airing or unannounced.

tmdb_api.description: RECOMMENDED: The Movie Database API provides the most structured access to season-level data

method_1_season_episodes.name: Season Episodes List
method_1_season_episodes.retrieval_logic: Retrieve the list of all episodes in a season. The air_date of the LAST episode in the array is the season end date.
method_1_season_episodes.notes: Most reliable method. Works for any season with aired episodes.
method_1_season_episodes.rate_limit: Requires one API call per season

method_2_last_episode_to_air.name: Last Episode To Air (Current Season Only)
method_2_last_episode_to_air.retrieval_logic: Use append_to_response on TV details call to include last_episode_to_air object. Best for CURRENT season tracking.
method_2_last_episode_to_air.notes: More efficient for tracking currently-airing shows. Only returns the most recent episode across ALL seasons.
method_2_last_episode_to_air.limitation: Only returns the LATEST episode to air, not per-season end dates
method_2_last_episode_to_air.use_case: Best for: Monitoring if new episodes have aired

workflow.step_1: Get the tv_id using /search/tv or lookup by external ID (/find/{external_id})
workflow.step_3: For each season, call /tv/{tv_id}/season/{season_number} and extract episodes[-1].air_date as season_end_date

imdb_datasets.description: IMDb provides data via official bulk datasets. No direct REST API for season-specific metadata.

title_episode_tsv.description: Contains episode-level data including air dates
title_episode_tsv.note: Air dates must be joined with title.basics.tsv

title_basics_tsv.note: startYear here is the episode air year

title_akas_tsv.description: Contains regional titles and additional date info

retrieval_logic.step_1: Query title.episode.tsv for all episodes WHERE parentTconst = series_tconst AND seasonNumber = target_season
retrieval_logic.step_2: Join with title.basics.tsv ON tconst to get startYear for each episode
retrieval_logic.step_3: Season end date = MAX(startYear) OR startYear of MAX(episodeNumber) for that season
retrieval_logic.sql_example:
SELECT e.parentTconst, e.seasonNumber, MAX(b.startYear) as season_end_year
FROM title_episode e
JOIN title_basics b ON e.tconst = b.tconst
WHERE e.parentTconst = 'tt0903747'
GROUP BY e.parentTconst, e.seasonNumber

limitations: Only provides YEAR granularity, not exact date
Requires downloading and processing large TSV files
Some episodes may have NULL startYear

omdb_api.description: OMDb API (Open Movie Database) provides simplified access to IMDb data including series date ranges
omdb_api.format: YYYY or YYYY-YYYY (e.g., "2008-2013" for Breaking Bad)

parsing_logic.if_single_year: Series is ongoing or single-season miniseries
parsing_logic.if_range: Split on hyphen; second value is series end year (applies to final season)
parsing_logic.example: 2008-2013 means series ended in 2013, final season (S5) ended in 2013

limitations: Only provides series-level end year, not per-season granularity
Year range applies to entire series, not individual seasons
Requires additional logic to map end year to specific season
omdb_api.use_case: Quick check for series completion status. Not suitable for season-specific end dates.

tvmaze_api.description: ALTERNATIVE: TVMaze API is known for highly accurate episode-level air dates

retrieval_logic.step_3: Filter episodes by season, get MAX(airdate) for that season

advantages: Free API with no key required for basic access
tvmaze_api.note: TVMaze is particularly useful when TMDB data is missing or when needing secondary validation

rapidapi_imdb.description: Third-party IMDb APIs available on RapidAPI marketplace
rapidapi_imdb.note: Multiple providers with varying accuracy and rate limits
rapidapi_imdb.use_case: Fallback when official sources are unavailable
rapidapi_imdb.cost: Freemium models with paid tiers for higher limits

retrieval_summary_table.description: Quick reference for season end date retrieval by source

currently_airing_seasons.warning: Season finales are often added to databases as they air. If a season is currently airing, the "end date" may not be available until the final episode is added.
currently_airing_seasons.recommendation: Check the series status field (TMDB: status, IMDb: endYear NULL) before assuming end_date is final
currently_airing_seasons.detection_logic: If TMDB status = "Returning Series" AND season_number = number_of_seasons, the final episode air_date may change

missing_data.tmdb_null_dates: Some episodes have NULL air_date in TMDB. Fall back to TVMaze or IMDb.
missing_data.limited_series: Miniseries may not have season structure - treat entire run as single season
missing_data.international_content: Non-English content may have delayed or incorrect air dates. Cross-validate with local sources.

validation_checks: season_end_date for season N must be <= season_start_date for season N+1
If series status = "Ended", final season should have a valid end_date

cranberry_implementation.null_meaning: Season currently airing, unannounced, or data unavailable
derivation_priority: 3. IMDb title.episode.tsv joined with title.basics.tsv (year only, use YYYY-12-31)
4. OMDb Year field (series-level, apply to final season only)

on_new_season: If still NULL, leave NULL and mark for manual review
on_season_complete: Confirm last episode air_date matches expected finale

validation_rules.rule_2: Use TVMaze as secondary validation for critical titles
validation_rules.rule_3: If only year available (IMDb/OMDb), format as YYYY-12-31 for season_end_date
validation_rules.rule_4: Never assume current season has ended - check series status first
validation_rules.rule_5: Log all retrieval failures for manual review queue

_max_seasons_field_mappings.description: MISSION CRITICAL: Canonical mapping of total season count fields. Controls season row production/appending.
_max_seasons_field_mappings.criticality: CATASTROPHIC if wrong - controls database row production
_max_seasons_field_mappings.reason: max_seasons determines how many season rows exist for a series. Wrong values cause database corruption.
_max_seasons_field_mappings.canonical_purpose: Total number of seasons for a TV series. MUST match actual season_number rows in database.

imdb.notes: IMDb does not have a single total_seasons field. Must derive from seasonNumber range in title.episode.tsv.

tmdb.notes: Direct field in TV show details API response. Most reliable source.

flixpatrol.notes: Used in Kaggle datasets and API exports.

hulu.notes: User-friendly label in content partner guidebook

apple_tv.notes: Does not display total season count. Uses 'Season Finale' / 'Series Finale' in episode descriptions.
apple_tv.internal_term: Planned Number of Seasons (likely, not confirmed)

netflix.notes: Displayed as 'X Seasons' in show details

max_seasons.purpose: Total season count for series - CONTROLS ROW PRODUCTION
max_seasons.validation: MUST equal COUNT(DISTINCT season_number) WHERE imdb_id = series_id

season_number.purpose: Season number for this specific row
season_number.validation: Must be <= max_seasons for the series

audit_requirements.description: MANDATORY audits to prevent database corruption

audit_1_row_count.check: For each imdb_id, COUNT(rows) must equal max_seasons
audit_1_row_count.query: SELECT imdb_id, max_seasons, COUNT(*) as actual FROM tv_seasons GROUP BY imdb_id HAVING max_seasons != COUNT(*)

audit_2_sequence.check: season_number must be sequential 1,2,3...max_seasons with no gaps
audit_2_sequence.query: Verify MIN(season_number)=1 AND MAX(season_number)=max_seasons AND COUNT(DISTINCT season_number)=max_seasons

audit_4_orphan_detection.query: SELECT * FROM tv_seasons WHERE season_number > max_seasons
audit_4_orphan_detection.severity: CRITICAL - orphan rows indicate data corruption

on_new_series: Cross-validate with IMDb season count if available
Create exactly max_seasons rows with season_number 1 to max_seasons
on_new_season_announced: Create new row with season_number = old_max_seasons + 1
on_season_cancelled: Do NOT decrement max_seasons if row already exists

_star_schema_architecture.description: ALGO 95.2 uses a STAR SCHEMA with two primary tables
rationale: Column explosion avoided: 4,320 platform columns -> 7 columns in dimension table
Sparse efficiency: Only stores views WHERE title is ACTUALLY available
Query flexibility: Easy aggregation by platform, country, period
Availability-aware: Uses streaming_lookup_*.json as ground truth

Cranberry_Titles.description: Main title catalog with total and country-level views
column_categories: temporal_total_views (~32 columns for total x 8 periods x 4 years)
temporal_country_views (~576 columns for 18 countries x 8 periods x 4 years)

Cranberry_Platform_Views.description: Platform-level view allocation (SPARSE - only where title available)

period.description: Temporal period (q1, q2, q3, q4, h1, h2)

confidence.description: Confidence score 0-1 based on data quality

join_specification.example_query: SELECT t.title, p.country, p.platform, SUM(p.views) FROM Cranberry_Titles t LEFT JOIN Cranberry_Platform_Views p ON t.fc_uid = p.fc_uid GROUP BY t.title, p.country, p.platform

_streaming_platforms_master.description: Global Streaming Platforms Master Reference - 85 platforms with canonical names, aliases, and subscriber data
_streaming_platforms_master.usage: Use canonical_lookup for platform name normalization. Use bfd_tracked list for platforms with viewership tracking.

_availability_gate.description: Platform views ONLY allocated where title is ACTUALLY available per streaming_lookup_*.json

allocation_rules.rule_2: For each title, check if imdb_id exists in ANY platform's title list
allocation_rules.rule_3: If title NOT available on ANY platform in country: allocate 0 views to ALL platforms
allocation_rules.rule_4: If title available on 1+ platforms: proportionally allocate among ONLY those platforms
allocation_rules.rule_5: Apply genre-platform affinity weights AFTER availability gate

fallback_behavior.unknown_availability: If title not found in lookup, use platform market share (no availability gate)
fallback_behavior.confidence_adjustment: Reduce confidence by 0.2 when using fallback

example_allocation.title: Breaking Bad S1
example_allocation.note: Views only go to platforms where title is actually available

_platform_allocation_formula.description: Three-step view allocation cascade with availability-aware platform split

STEP_1_total.formula: V_total = ML_ensemble × scale_factor × S_i × T_g × period_weight
STEP_1_total.output: Single total view count per title per period
STEP_1_total.note: RENAMED from V_global in V22.00 for clarity

STEP_2_country.output: 18 country-level view counts per title per period

components.availability_mask: 1 if title available on platform in country, 0 otherwise (from streaming_lookup_*.json)
components.platform_share: Market share of platform in country (from platform_allocation_weights.json)

STEP_3_platform.normalization: After applying availability mask, re-normalize platform shares to sum to 1.0

_platform_allocation_formula.conservation_law: SUM(V_country for all 18 countries) = V_total (views conserved, just distributed)

_platform_exclusivity_v95.2.description: Studio-based and origin-based platform exclusivity overrides (v95.2)

studio_exclusivity_rules.description: UK content exclusivity to Western markets

international_content_exclusivity.description: Non-English content with exclusive Western streaming deals

implementation_in_phase_6_5.step_1: Load exclusivity rules from component files
implementation_in_phase_6_5.step_2: For each title, check studio/origin country against exclusivity patterns
implementation_in_phase_6_5.step_3: If exclusivity match: apply override percentage to target platform
implementation_in_phase_6_5.step_4: Reduce other platforms proportionally (conservation law preserved)
implementation_in_phase_6_5.step_5: Continue with normal availability gate and genre affinity

_social_signal_integration_v95.2.description: Multi-platform social signal integration for enhanced viewership prediction (v95.2)

_56_signals_framework._description: ALGO 95.2 uses 56 correlated signals in 9 SETs for 92% quarterly / 75% daily accuracy

formulas.47_wvv: views x completion x beta_p x lambda_g^-1

x_feature_columns._description: 20 Abstract X-Features from FC-BFD-Abstract-v12.00.parquet - ALL OPTIONAL/NULLABLE

wvv_columns._formula: WVV = Views x Completion x beta_p x lambda_g^-1

nielsen_weekly_columns._description: V26.00 NEW: Nielsen Weekly Streaming Top 10 data columns for weekly temporal granularity

nielsen_minutes_millions.description: Minutes viewed in millions as reported by Nielsen

avg_view_duration_min.description: Average viewing duration assumption per view in minutes (VALUABLE for views calculation)
avg_view_duration_min.note: Critical for converting minutes to views: views = minutes / avg_view_duration_min

streaming_platform_primary.description: Primary/source streaming platform for the title

views_weekly_us.description: Weekly views allocated to United States

views_weekly_total.description: Total weekly views worldwide before country allocation

views_weekly_gb.description: Weekly views allocated to United Kingdom

views_weekly_kr.description: Weekly views allocated to South Korea

views_weekly_row.description: Weekly views allocated to Rest of World

platform_subscribers.description: Platform subscriber count at time of measurement

data_origin.description: Source of the data (e.g., Nielsen Weekly Streaming Top 10)

us_weight_pct.description: US weight percentage used in country allocation

conversion_formula.description: Formula used to calculate views from source metric

uk_normalization_rules._RULE: Store United Kingdom as 'gb'. Map from GB/GBR on ingestion. NEVER store as 'uk' or 'gbr'.
uk_normalization_rules.mapping_function: lambda x: 'gb' if x.lower() in ['gb', 'gbr', 'great_britain', 'britain', 'united_kingdom', 'uk'] else x

country_allocation_18._v22_fix: FIXED: Removed 'global' from countries list - it was incorrectly included as item #19
_calculation_order: 1. Calculate TOTAL views for title per temporal period (views_*_total)
2. Apply 18-country allocation percentages to distribute total views

row.name: Rest of World
row.note: ROW is a country ALLOCATION (2%), NOT a synonym for 'total'

formula.total_views: V_total = ML_ensemble x scale_factor x S_i x T_g x period_weight

genre_conversion_table._description: Genre-specific hours_per_view conversion factors from ALGO 65.2

platform_elasticity_coefficients._formula_context: WVV = Views x Completion x beta_p x lambda_g^-1

context_adjustment_weights._description: Regional context adjustment factors from ALGO 65.2

title_type_value_mapping._description: CANONICAL: Only 'film' and 'tv_show' are valid title_type values

temporal_column_patterns._v22_fix: FIXED: Removed 'global' from allocation_countries_18. 'total' is now separate.

total_views.description: Worldwide total views BEFORE country allocation

_country_allocation_ratios.description: Country allocation weight ratios - percentage of global views allocated to each country
_country_allocation_ratios.usage: Used for country-specific view allocation from global totals

_deprecated_columns_v23_20.description: Columns deprecated and removed in V23.20
_deprecated_columns_v23_20.reason: These columns were experimental features that are no longer used in the ML pipeline. Data available in Components/ files.

data_source_mapping.computed_views: Replaced by views_computed column (already in schema)
data_source_mapping.interaction_features: Can be recomputed at runtime from base columns

total_columns.note: V22.00: Actual count depends on years covered and optional columns populated

_cranberry_naming_convention.description: All output files use Cranberry_[Descriptor]_V[version].parquet naming

Cranberry_Titles.description: Main fact table with title metadata and country-level views

version_history.V3.2: Added premiere_date 100% coverage, TV season rule validation
version_history.V4.10: Star schema implementation with platform availability gate
version_history.V24.00: ALGO 95.2 canon compliance, topology v10.00 alignment

_validation_rules.rule_1: fc_uid must match pattern tt#######_S## for TV seasons or tt####### for films
_validation_rules.rule_2: Country weights must sum to exactly 100.0%
_validation_rules.rule_3: UK must be stored as 'gb' (mapped from GB/GBR/UK on ingestion)
_validation_rules.rule_4: X-features are optional but must be within defined ranges when present
_validation_rules.rule_5: WVV = views x completion x beta_p x lambda_g^-1
_validation_rules.rule_7: CRITICAL: Release validation MUST occur before view allocation
_validation_rules.rule_8: Titles with status in UNRELEASED_STATUSES must have views=0
_validation_rules.rule_9: Titles with premiere_date > today must have views=0
_validation_rules.rule_10: Titles with start_year > current_year must have views=0
_validation_rules.rule_11: STAR SCHEMA: Platform views ONLY in Cranberry_Platform_Views table (not columns)
_validation_rules.rule_12: AVAILABILITY GATE: Platform views only allocated where title IS available per streaming_lookup_*.json
_validation_rules.rule_13: CONSERVATION: SUM(platform_views) for country must equal country_views in Cranberry_Titles
_validation_rules.rule_14: FLIXPATROL: Only 3 columns allowed (flixpatrol_id, flixpatrol_points, flixpatrol_rank) - all other data merges to BFD columns
_validation_rules.rule_15: TOTAL-COUNTRY CONSERVATION: SUM(all 18 country view columns) must equal total view column for each period/year

_hardwired_paths.description: HARDWIRED DATA PATHS for ALGO 95.2 execution

input_database.name: Cranberry_V3.2_with_xfeatures.parquet
input_database.note: Phase 3 (X-Feature Creation) already completed in this file

_release_validation.description: ALGO 95.2 must validate release status BEFORE allocating views (Phase 5.5)
_release_validation.reason: Reacher S4 bug - views allocated to announced but unreleased content

validation_layers.layer_1_status: PRIMARY - Check if status in UNRELEASED_STATUSES

_release_validation.data_quality_note: As of 2026-01-12, premiere_date is 100% populated in Cranberry_V3.2_with_xfeatures.parquet. Use status as primary filter, premiere_date as secondary.

_studio_vs_production_company_v80_19.description: CRITICAL DISTINCTION: Physical Studios vs Production Companies (v80.19)
_studio_vs_production_company_v80_19.reason: Database had incorrect definitions mixing physical facilities with content creators

tv_studio_definition.description: Physical facility for video production (soundstages, equipment, post-production)
key_characteristics: Can be RENTED by production companies

production_company_definition.description: Business entity that manages content creation from concept to delivery

critical_distinction.note: Same parent company, DIFFERENT entity types!

studio.old_meaning: Ambiguous - mixed studios and production companies

production_company_primary.description: Primary production company for the content

validation_rules.rule_1: studio_facility should ONLY contain physical facility names
validation_rules.rule_2: production_company_primary should ONLY contain content creator names
validation_rules.rule_3: Use studio_vs_production_company.py classifier for ambiguous entities
validation_rules.rule_4: Legacy 'studio' column preserved for backwards compatibility but DEPRECATED

_streaming_release_date_architecture.description: CANON: Streaming release date vs premiere date distinction (V25.00)

start_year.meaning: Year content becomes available on streaming platform

streaming_release_date.meaning: Exact date content becomes available on streaming
streaming_release_date.derivation: If premiere_year == start_year: use premiere_date; else: start_year-01-01 (placeholder)

is_catalog_addition.meaning: Boolean flag indicating old content added to streaming later

_canonical_column_taxonomy_v25.description: CANON: Official column taxonomy for BFD database per ViewerDBX Platform Engine & Topology v10.00
